page.title: 01NORTH KEWSTOKE
page.content: This coastal area is on the southern shore of the Bristol Channel taking in the northern region of the parish of Kewstoke and touching Wick St Lawrence.Although it fringes on the holiday resort of Sand Bay and is close to Weston-S-Mare, much of the land is farmed with part of it owned by the National Trust. The hilly peninsula of Sand Point is contrasted by the plain to its south and east which is well drained low lying farmland.The fields are used mainly for grazing and growing grass for hay or silage. The area is rich in wildlife with an extensive saltmarsh and nature reserve. The most interesting of the very few buildings in this rural area is an ancient priory.
